			<title>Post-conflict reconciliation led to societal healing, but worsened psychological health</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512161058.htm</link>
			<description>Reconciliation programs promote societal healing, but that these gains come at the cost of reduced psychological health, worsening depression, anxiety, and trauma.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=h3KC0Ie298Y:zz3ovZ0fVWA:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=h3KC0Ie298Y:zz3ovZ0fVWA:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=h3KC0Ie298Y:zz3ovZ0fVWA:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=h3KC0Ie298Y:zz3ovZ0fVWA:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=h3KC0Ie298Y:zz3ovZ0fVWA:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Diabetes drug found no better than placebo at treating nonalcoholic fatty liver disease</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512160657.htm</link>
			<description>A diabetes medication described in some studies as an effective treatment for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) works no better than a placebo, report researchers after conducting the first randomized, double-blind, controlled clinical trial of sitagliptin, an oral antihyperglycemic marketed under the name Januvia.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=S-8smHrDsRQ:ijreh_mpeFk:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=S-8smHrDsRQ:ijreh_mpeFk:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=S-8smHrDsRQ:ijreh_mpeFk:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=S-8smHrDsRQ:ijreh_mpeFk:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=S-8smHrDsRQ:ijreh_mpeFk:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:06:57 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512160657.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Rare human disease found in dogs</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512160654.htm</link>
			<description>A rare, severe form of pulmonary hypertension, which up until now, has only been classified as a human lung disease, has also been discovered in dogs according to an American study.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=UVubUSHx0us:S-1WcHk3jo4:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=UVubUSHx0us:S-1WcHk3jo4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=UVubUSHx0us:S-1WcHk3jo4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=UVubUSHx0us:S-1WcHk3jo4:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=UVubUSHx0us:S-1WcHk3jo4:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>

		<item>
			<title>Ingestible robot operates in simulated stomach</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512160651.htm</link>
			<description>In experiments involving a simulation of the human esophagus and stomach, researchers have demonstrated a tiny origami robot that can unfold itself from a swallowed capsule and, steered by external magnetic fields, crawl across the stomach wall to remove a swallowed button battery or patch a wound.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=5h13HQ994vg:QW_jcG51YpU:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=5h13HQ994vg:QW_jcG51YpU:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=5h13HQ994vg:QW_jcG51YpU:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=5h13HQ994vg:QW_jcG51YpU:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=5h13HQ994vg:QW_jcG51YpU:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<media:thumbnail url="https://images.sciencedaily.com/2016/05/160512160651.jpg" height="200" width="300" />
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:06:51 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512160651.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Gene regulatory mutation linked to rare childhood cancer</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145459.htm</link>
			<description>A single defect in a gene that codes for a histone -- a 'spool' that wraps idle DNA -- is linked to pediatric cancers, a new study indicates. Histones derive their pattern from the same genome that they help to pack up and organize.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=iZkQ5xugxA8:hDzX-_pijB4:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=iZkQ5xugxA8:hDzX-_pijB4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=iZkQ5xugxA8:hDzX-_pijB4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=iZkQ5xugxA8:hDzX-_pijB4:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=iZkQ5xugxA8:hDzX-_pijB4:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<media:thumbnail url="https://images.sciencedaily.com/2016/05/160512145459.jpg" height="135" width="300" />
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:54:59 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145459.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Database helps researchers connect exposures to health effects, compare diseases</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145455.htm</link>
			<description>Two new studies give researchers new strategies for connecting environmental exposures to human health effects. To determine whether a drug can be used to treat more than one disease, scientists look for overlaps between the set of genes that play a role in each disease: the more genes in common, the more likely the drug can be repurposed to treat both illnesses. The problem is that not all the genes involved in any one disease are always known, they say.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Txc0YXfQOgI:tscthgeWzP4:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Txc0YXfQOgI:tscthgeWzP4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Txc0YXfQOgI:tscthgeWzP4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Txc0YXfQOgI:tscthgeWzP4:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Txc0YXfQOgI:tscthgeWzP4:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:54:55 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145455.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Team discovers new HIV vaccine target</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145332.htm</link>
			<description>A team of scientists has reported a research trifecta. They discovered a new vulnerable site on HIV for a vaccine to target, a broadly neutralizing antibody that binds to that target site, and how the antibody stops the virus from infecting a cell.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Ak9JnZLKoJc:f4BN1WMo10s:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Ak9JnZLKoJc:f4BN1WMo10s:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Ak9JnZLKoJc:f4BN1WMo10s:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Ak9JnZLKoJc:f4BN1WMo10s:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=Ak9JnZLKoJc:f4BN1WMo10s:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<media:thumbnail url="https://images.sciencedaily.com/2016/05/160512145332.jpg" height="212" width="300" />
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:53:32 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145332.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Study of glioma susceptibility in dogs may yield insights for humans</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145323.htm</link>
			<description>A new study of the genetic factors underlying glioma formation in dogs may hold clues to how these common and often untreatable tumors form in humans. The genome study, which was conducted across 25 dog breeds, identified three genes associated with the tumor.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=knXNBGSzfhs:A0MYLR-4tfk:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=knXNBGSzfhs:A0MYLR-4tfk:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=knXNBGSzfhs:A0MYLR-4tfk:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=knXNBGSzfhs:A0MYLR-4tfk:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=knXNBGSzfhs:A0MYLR-4tfk:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<media:thumbnail url="https://images.sciencedaily.com/2016/05/160512145323.jpg" height="452" width="300" />
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:53:23 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512145323.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Women's preference for smaller competition may account for inequality</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512142920.htm</link>
			<description>When applying for a job or to college, women seek positions with fewer applicants than men, according to a new study. The researchers found that the size of a competition--such as the number of applicants to a particular job or the number of people vying for a monetary reward--shapes who enters the competition.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=JYLW8447JIY:m8v8H0yMYPc:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=JYLW8447JIY:m8v8H0yMYPc:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=JYLW8447JIY:m8v8H0yMYPc:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=JYLW8447JIY:m8v8H0yMYPc:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=JYLW8447JIY:m8v8H0yMYPc:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:29:20 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512142920.htm</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Distance makes the habits healthier: Advice on snacking</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512131736.htm</link>
			<description>Free food: It’s a growing workplace trend, especially in tech companies, to incentivize productivity and morale around the office. But how can companies promote healthy choices and still provide indulgent goodies? Google executives asked a consumer behavior expert to help them resolve that question by examining the role of relative proximity in behavior.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Depression is driven by networks of genes that span brain circuits, study suggests</title>

			<description>Depression is a disorder that involves changes in coordinated networks of hundreds of genes across key brain circuits, according to a study. Researchers show through their work how tweaking gene networks can affect susceptibility to depression.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Use of complementary, alternative medicine affects initiation of chemotherapy</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512125428.htm</link>
			<description>Women with early-stage breast cancer for whom chemotherapy was indicated and who used dietary supplements and multiple types of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) were less likely to start chemotherapy than nonusers of alternative therapies, according to new research. 		<item>
			<title>Gene expression depends on aonstant dialogue between nucleus, cytoplasm</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512125426.htm</link>
			<description>Gene expression is the process by which genetic information is used to produce proteins, essential for cells to function properly. It takes place in two steps (first the transcription, then the translation), considered to be two independent processes until now. Today, microbiologists provide additional evidence that they are intrinsically related and that a protein complex called Ccr4-Not plays a key role in gene expression by acting as a messenger between the nucleus and the cytoplasm.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vt0eHLVCEQY:9Oq6H6KmTMQ:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vt0eHLVCEQY:9Oq6H6KmTMQ:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vt0eHLVCEQY:9Oq6H6KmTMQ:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vt0eHLVCEQY:9Oq6H6KmTMQ:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vt0eHLVCEQY:9Oq6H6KmTMQ:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>New SLENDR technique: Protein labeling in developing brain by genome editing</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512125424.htm</link>
			<description>A research team has developed a method, called SLENDR, that allows precise modification of neuronal DNA in living samples. Using their new technique, the research team was able to reliably label two different proteins with distinct colors at the same time in the same cell. The researchers used a variety of imaging methods as well as DNA sequencing to confirm that the SLENDR method had truly and precisely knocked in the genes.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Stopping cancer in its tracks</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512124918.htm</link>
			<description>Inhibiting autophagy, the process cells use to degrade large intra-cellular cargo, effectively blocks tumor cell migration and breast cancer metastasis in tumor models. Metastasis is responsible for 90 percent of cancer deaths. There are approved drugs that can disrupt autophagy.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=HMilQWUtYIU:5YCH2xLAOds:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=HMilQWUtYIU:5YCH2xLAOds:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=HMilQWUtYIU:5YCH2xLAOds:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=HMilQWUtYIU:5YCH2xLAOds:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=HMilQWUtYIU:5YCH2xLAOds:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Scientists identify key factor in mitochondrial calcium uptake and bioenergetics</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512124916.htm</link>
			<description>Mitochondria are the energy-generating batteries of cells, but they also perform other critical functions, including protecting cells against calcium overload, a significant cause of cell death in certain cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases. Underlying this safety mechanism is a protein complex known as the mitochondrial Ca2+ uniporter (MCU). New work shows how MCU proteins come together to effect calcium uptake, shedding new light on the physiological role of the MCU complex and its importance to cellular bioenergetics.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=YtZS8RoWR8E:gWogrdcoljQ:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=YtZS8RoWR8E:gWogrdcoljQ:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=YtZS8RoWR8E:gWogrdcoljQ:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=YtZS8RoWR8E:gWogrdcoljQ:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=YtZS8RoWR8E:gWogrdcoljQ:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>

		<item>
			<title>Melatonin signaling is a risk factor for type 2 diabetes</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512124913.htm</link>
			<description>A sleeping pancreas releases less insulin, but how much insulin drops each night may differ from person to person, suggests a new study. Up to 30 percent of the population may be predisposed to have a pancreas that's more sensitive to the insulin-inhibiting effects of melatonin. People with this increased sensitivity carry a slightly altered melatonin receptor gene that is a known risk factor for type 2 diabetes.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=zc29dWhwygE:GRE2c_Hh0M8:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=zc29dWhwygE:GRE2c_Hh0M8:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=zc29dWhwygE:GRE2c_Hh0M8:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=zc29dWhwygE:GRE2c_Hh0M8:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=zc29dWhwygE:GRE2c_Hh0M8:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Zika virus: Optimized tests for reliable diagnosis</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512102626.htm</link>
			<description>Scientists have shown that not all conventional Zika virus molecular diagnostic tests are sufficiently reliable. Diagnosing Zika viruses reliably is of major importance--for both patients and further research on the spread of the virus. The Zika virus is currently spreading in Central and South America; over one million people have become infected since spring 2015.<div class="feedflare">

		<item>
			<title>Hay fever's hidden supporting substances</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512102624.htm</link>
			<description>Up to now, research into pollen allergies has largely focused on allergens. Upon contact with the nasal mucous membrane, however, pollen releases a host of other substances. A team of researchers has investigated effects of these substances. It emerged that non-allergenic components have a significant influence on the immune response. The results suggest that it may be time to rethink the current methods of treating allergies.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>babies of mothers with gestational diabetes have more body fat, Scans reveal</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512102612.htm</link>
			<description>Babies born to mothers with gestational diabetes have more body fat at two months of age compared to babies born to healthy mothers, says a new study. Scientists used MRI scanning to measure body fat in 86 babies -- they took these readings shortly after birth, and again when the babies were 8-12 weeks old.<div class="feedflare">

		<item>
			<title>Marijuana use in pregnancy is major risk for pre-term birth</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512100947.htm</link>
			<description>For the first time, science has shown a direct link between continued marijuana use during pregnancy and pre-term birth. The results show that once all other major risk factors have been accounted for, continued marijuana use through to 20 weeks' gestation is independently associated with a five-fold increase in the risk of pre-term birth.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vXi787RKzzQ:e0gDEzCnx5M:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vXi787RKzzQ:e0gDEzCnx5M:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vXi787RKzzQ:e0gDEzCnx5M:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vXi787RKzzQ:e0gDEzCnx5M:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=vXi787RKzzQ:e0gDEzCnx5M:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Migrant money puts aid in the shade</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512100710.htm</link>
			<description>International remittances have poverty and inequality-reducing effects in Sub-Saharan Africa, new research suggests. The results suggest that a 10% increase in remittances as share of gross domestic product (GDP) will lead to a 1.2% decline in the number of people living on less than US$1.25 per day, 2.4% decline in the depth of poverty, 3.1% decline in the number of people living in extreme poverty and 1.5% decline in inequality.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=XK9zB0l-P40:BCzKiQQ-d4E:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=XK9zB0l-P40:BCzKiQQ-d4E:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=XK9zB0l-P40:BCzKiQQ-d4E:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=XK9zB0l-P40:BCzKiQQ-d4E:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=XK9zB0l-P40:BCzKiQQ-d4E:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Viruses detected in Swedish mosquito larvae</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512100513.htm</link>
			<description>After an outbreak of Ockelbo disease in northern Sweden in 2013, researchers were able to trace the virus to mosquitoes. In a new study, researchers have shown that mosquito larvae also carry viruses that can cause infectious disease. These include the Sindbis virus, which causes Ockelbo disease, which is associated with fever, rashes and prolonged joint pain.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Two imaging catheters unite to better detect dangerous plaques in arteries</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085353.htm</link>
			<description>A promising new method for identifying atherosclerotic plaques, the encased deposits in arteries that restrict blood flow and can lead to heart attack or stroke, has been revealed by researchers. The technique combines two different types of imaging, allowing for an unprecedented combination of depth and detail. The hybrid technology will provide doctors with a better diagnostic tool for identifying particularly problematic plaques.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Chronic drinking interferes with absorption of critical vitamins by pancreas</title>

			<description>Chronic exposure to alcohol interferes with the pancreas’ ability to absorb vitamin C, potentially predisposing the body to pancreatitis and other pancreatic diseases, a new study reports. 		<item>
			<title>Should we rethink of causes of dementia?</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085344.htm</link>

			<title>Loneliness in midlife: Risk of becoming lonely is not limited to old age</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085220.htm</link>
			<description>Investigators have been able to find out in which phases of our lives we are most at risk of becoming lonely. 		<item>
			<title>Social engineering: Password in exchange for chocolate</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085123.htm</link>
			<description>It requires a lot of effort and expense for computer hackers to program a Trojan virus and infiltrate individual or company computers. They are therefore increasingly relying on psychological strategies to manipulate computer users into voluntarily divulging their login details. These methods are known as “social engineering”. For the first time, psychologists have conducted a large-scale study (involving 1,208 people) to investigate how people are manipulated into sharing their passwords with complete strangers in return for small gifts.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=mwlrlw_39lo:keWVZO-K9iU:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=mwlrlw_39lo:keWVZO-K9iU:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=mwlrlw_39lo:keWVZO-K9iU:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=mwlrlw_39lo:keWVZO-K9iU:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=mwlrlw_39lo:keWVZO-K9iU:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>More urinary tract stones are being treated with surgery</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085121.htm</link>
			<description>Researchers who analyzed recent trends related to urinary tract stones in the UK found a sustained and high prevalence of the condition, with an increased trend to treat patients with surgery. The number of upper urinary tract stone episodes in hospitals increased from 83,050 in 2009-2010 to 86,742 in 2014-2015. The use of non-invasive shock wave lithotripsy remained stable over this time; however, surgical intervention for stones in the ureter or kidney rose nearly 50% from 12,062 to 18,055 cases in the 5-year study period.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=MH2ReNbuIGk:CGrYFcm5uiU:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=MH2ReNbuIGk:CGrYFcm5uiU:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=MH2ReNbuIGk:CGrYFcm5uiU:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=MH2ReNbuIGk:CGrYFcm5uiU:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=MH2ReNbuIGk:CGrYFcm5uiU:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>

			<description>A new molecule has been discovered that has the potential to prolong the life of individuals with cystic fibrosis (CF). 			<title>Emotions in the age of Botox</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085113.htm</link>
			<description>Aesthetic treatments based on botulin toxin affect the perception of emotions, new research shows. The consequence of having Botox injected, scientists explain, depends on a temporary block of proprioceptive feedback, a process that helps us understand other people's emotions by reproducing them on our own bodies.<div class="feedflare">

		<item>
			<title>Donor kidneys may be discarded due to 'weekend effect' at hospitals</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512085111.htm</link>
			<description>Investigators have uncovered a “weekend effect” contributing to the worsening availability of donor kidneys in the United States. They found that kidneys that would normally be made available for transplantation were less likely to be procured from donors over the weekend (89.5% on the weekend vs. 90.2% during the week). Further, organs procured during the weekend were more than 20% more likely to be discarded than kidneys procured on other days, although the discarded kidneys were of higher quality on average than those discarded during the week, according to a new report.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=hBzdf5_Cshs:iWZ_fv5_rZw:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=hBzdf5_Cshs:iWZ_fv5_rZw:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=hBzdf5_Cshs:iWZ_fv5_rZw:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=hBzdf5_Cshs:iWZ_fv5_rZw:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=hBzdf5_Cshs:iWZ_fv5_rZw:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
</div></description>

			<description>Scientists have developed a material that can mimic cartilage and potentially encourage it to re-grow. 			<description>Extensive burn injuries are usually treated by transplanting layers of skin from other parts of the body. 			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512084551.htm</link>
			<description>Medical researchers have identified fatty acid oxidation intermediates as being significantly upregulated in a MYC-driven model of TNBC. 			<title>HIV testing during early infection may reduce new cases in high-risk communities</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160512084549.htm</link>
			<description>Detecting HIV earlier, through screening programs that can identify the virus shortly after infection, may lead to lower rates of HIV transmission in local epidemics, suggest findings from a new study. 			<description>Two linked papers shed new light on the relation of alcohol and diet with breast cancer and heart disease. 			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511210628.htm</link>
			<description>Crowdsourcing has brought us Wikipedia and ways to understand how HIV proteins fold. 			<title>Fruit discovery could provide new treatments for obesity, type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511210619.htm</link>
			<description>A combination of two compounds found in red grapes and oranges could be used to improve the health of people with diabetes, and reduce cases of obesity and heart disease. 		<item>
			<title>Abortion rates at all-time low in developed countries but remain unchanged in developing countries</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511210615.htm</link>
			<description>Abortion rates have declined significantly over the last 25 years in developed countries and are at a historic low. But in developing countries, where many abortions are unsafe, rates have remained level, highlighting the urgent need for better access to modern contraception (eg, hormonal pill, implants, IUDs) to reduce unwanted pregnancies and abortions.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=e__S6CnkapY:MSBceMvwseU:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=e__S6CnkapY:MSBceMvwseU:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=e__S6CnkapY:MSBceMvwseU:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=e__S6CnkapY:MSBceMvwseU:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=e__S6CnkapY:MSBceMvwseU:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Persistent childhood asthma linked to COPD</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511210610.htm</link>
			<description>In the largest and longest US analysis of persistent asthmatics to date, investigators have found a link between persistent childhood asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease in early adulthood. The study found that early lung function predicts lung growth later in life, regardless of asthma treatment and smoking exposure.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=EIEkyqVNHyc:hGZgwPZI9xQ:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=EIEkyqVNHyc:hGZgwPZI9xQ:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=EIEkyqVNHyc:hGZgwPZI9xQ:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=EIEkyqVNHyc:hGZgwPZI9xQ:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=EIEkyqVNHyc:hGZgwPZI9xQ:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Caregivers of ICU survivors at high risk of developing depression, emotional distress</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511210606.htm</link>
			<description>A new study focusing on caregiver outcomes of critically ill patients reveals that caregivers of intensive care unit (ICU) survivors, who have received mechanical ventilation for a minimum of seven days, are at a high risk of developing clinical depression persisting up to one year after discharge.<div class="feedflare">

			<title>Multiple sclerosis drug mitoxantrone may be linked to increased risk of colorectal cancer</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511162555.htm</link>
			<description>The multiple sclerosis (MS) drug mitoxantrone may be associated with an increased risk of colorectal cancer, according to a study. Mitoxantrone suppresses the immune system. It was first developed as a chemotherapy drug for certain cancers.<div class="feedflare">

		<item>
			<title>Pertussis vaccination in pregnancy is safe, study finds</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511162433.htm</link>
			<description>Tetanus-diphtheria-acellular pertussis (Tdap) vaccine is recommended for all pregnant women in the U.S. as the key medical intervention to protect newborn infants from pertussis (whooping cough). However, the safety of giving the Tdap vaccine to pregnant women has not been fully determined. According to a new study the Tdap vaccine is safe for both mothers and infants.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=O-4-zxDghJw:zMeygITB0jo:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=O-4-zxDghJw:zMeygITB0jo:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=O-4-zxDghJw:zMeygITB0jo:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=O-4-zxDghJw:zMeygITB0jo:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=O-4-zxDghJw:zMeygITB0jo:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>

		<item>
			<title>Fast casual restaurant entrées higher in calories than fast food</title>
			<link>https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/05/160511162341.htm</link>
			<description>Dieters looking to cut calories may believe it's best to pick a fast casual restaurant over a fast food chain, but new research shows that may not be the best choice. According to researchers, entrées at fast casual restaurants -- a category that includes restaurants such as Chipotle and Panera Bread -- have a higher average calorie count than fast food establishments, such as a McDonald's or Bojangles.<div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=i0H0tIXuyEc:kC5muL-xev4:Gqkty0xVXF4"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Gqkty0xVXF4" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=i0H0tIXuyEc:kC5muL-xev4:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=i0H0tIXuyEc:kC5muL-xev4:qj6IDK7rITs"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=qj6IDK7rITs" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=i0H0tIXuyEc:kC5muL-xev4:uY-AgU320Y0"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=uY-AgU320Y0" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.sciencedaily.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?a=i0H0tIXuyEc:kC5muL-xev4:Ue2SbndxCZY"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/sciencedaily/top_news/top_health?d=Ue2SbndxCZY" border="0"></img></a>
